title.raw: 《張丞相列傳》 Biography of Chancellor Zhang

sentences.zh: 張丞相蒼者，陽武人也。

translations.literal: Zhang Cang, the Chancellor, was a man from Yangwu.

sentences.zh: 好書律歷。

translations.literal: He was fond of books, laws, and calendars.

sentences.zh: 秦時為御史，主柱下方書。

translations.literal: During Qin times he served as a censor in charge of the square books below the pillar.

sentences.zh: 有罪，亡歸。

translations.literal: He committed a crime and fled back home.

sentences.zh: 及沛公略地過陽武，蒼以客從攻南陽。

translations.literal: When the Duke of Pei was raiding territory and passed through Yangwu, Cang followed as a guest to attack Nanyang.

sentences.zh: 蒼坐法當斬，解衣伏質，身長大，肥白如瓠，時王陵見而怪其美士，乃言沛公，赦勿斬。

translations.literal: Cang was convicted by law and should be beheaded. He loosened his clothes and lay on the execution block. His body was tall and large, fat and white like a gourd. At the time Wang Ling saw him and marveled at this beautiful gentleman, so he spoke to the Duke of Pei, who pardoned him and did not behead him.

sentences.zh: 遂從西入武關，至咸陽。

translations.literal: He then followed west through Wuguan and arrived at Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，入漢中，還定三秦。

translations.literal: The Duke of Pei was established as King of Han, entered Hanzhong, and returned to settle the Three Qin.

sentences.zh: 陳餘擊走常山王張耳，耳歸漢，漢乃以張蒼為常山守。

translations.literal: Chen Yu struck and drove away Changshan king Zhang Er. Er returned to Han, and Han then made Zhang Cang Changshan governor.

sentences.zh: 從淮陰侯擊趙，蒼得陳餘。

translations.literal: He followed Marquis Huaiyin in striking Zhao, and Cang captured Chen Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙地已平，漢王以蒼為代相，備邊寇。

translations.literal: Once Zhao lands were pacified, the Han king made Cang chancellor of Dai to prepare against border bandits.

sentences.zh: 已而徙為趙相，相趙王耳。

translations.literal: Soon after he was moved to serve as chancellor of Zhao, chancellor to Zhao king Er.

sentences.zh: 耳卒，相趙王敖。

translations.literal: Er died, and he served as chancellor to Zhao king Ao.

sentences.zh: 復徙相代王。

translations.literal: He was again moved to serve as chancellor to the Dai king.

sentences.zh: 燕王臧荼反，高祖往擊之。

translations.literal: Yan king Zang Tu rebelled, and Gaozu went to strike him.

sentences.zh: 蒼以代相從攻臧荼有功，以六年中封為北平侯，食邑千二百戶。

translations.literal: Cang as Dai chancellor followed in attacking Zang Tu with merit. In the middle of the sixth year he was enfeoffed as Marquis of Beiping, with a food fief of one thousand two hundred households.

Zhang Cang, the Chancellor, hailed from Yangwu. He had a passion for texts on law and calendrical systems. During the Qin dynasty, he served as an imperial secretary overseeing the archives beneath the pillar. Having committed an offense, he fled back to his home region. When the Duke of Pei led troops to seize territory between Xiao and Pei, Xiao He, as the chief clerk of Pei county, recommended Cang and sent him to join the army. Xiao He, as the chief clerk of Pei county, recommended Cang and sent him to join the army. Cang followed as a guest in the attack on Nanyang. Because Cang had been a Qin imperial secretary, he understood the laws and regulations well. He handled military affairs properly and was promoted to governor of Changshan. He was assigned to General Zhao, who esteemed him highly. Cang served as governor of Changshan and was assigned to General Zhao. The lands of Zhao were already pacified, and the Han king appointed Cang as prime minister of Dai to defend the borders.

sentences.zh: 遷為計相，一月，更以列侯為主計四歲。

translations.literal: He was moved to serve as accounting chancellor. After one month, he was changed to serve as chief accountant for four years as a ranked marquis.

sentences.zh: 是時蕭何為相國，而張蒼乃自秦時為柱下史，明習天下圖書計籍。

translations.literal: At this time Xiao He served as prime minister, but Zhang Cang had since Qin times served as the historian below the pillar, clearly versed in the world's maps, books, and accounting records.

sentences.zh: 蒼又善用算律歷，故令蒼以列侯居相府，領主郡國上計者。

translations.literal: Cang was again skilled in using calculations, laws, and calendars, so he was ordered to reside in the prime minister's mansion as a ranked marquis, leading those in charge of commandery and state account submissions.

sentences.zh: 黥布反亡，漢立皇子長為淮南王，而張蒼相之。

translations.literal: Qing Bu rebelled and fled. Han established imperial son Chang as King of Huainan, and Zhang Cang served as his chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十四年，遷為御史大夫。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, he was moved to serve as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 周昌者，沛人也。

translations.literal: Zhou Chang was a man from Pei.

sentences.zh: 其從兄曰周苛，秦時皆為泗水卒史。

translations.literal: His elder cousin was called Zhou Ke. During Qin times they both served as soldier secretaries in Sishui.

sentences.zh: 及高祖起沛，擊破泗水守監，於是周昌、周苛自卒史從沛公，沛公以周昌為職志，周苛為客。

translations.literal: When Gaozu rose at Pei and struck and broke the Sishui guard and supervisor, then Zhou Chang and Zhou Ke followed the Duke of Pei from their positions as soldier secretaries. The Duke of Pei made Zhou Chang duty recorder and Zhou Ke a guest.

sentences.zh: 從入關，破秦。

translations.literal: They followed in entering the pass and breaking Qin.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，以周苛為御史大夫，周昌為中尉。

translations.literal: The Duke of Pei was established as King of Han. He made Zhou Ke Censor Grand Master and Zhou Chang Central Commandery Captain.

sentences.zh: 漢王四年，楚圍漢王滎陽急，漢王遁出去，而使周苛守滎陽城。

translations.literal: In the fourth year of the Han king, Chu urgently surrounded the Han king at Xingyang. The Han king fled out, but sent Zhou Ke to guard Xingyang city.

sentences.zh: 楚破滎陽城，欲令周苛將。

translations.literal: Chu broke Xingyang city and wished to make Zhou Ke lead.

sentences.zh: 苛罵曰：「若趣降漢王！

translations.literal: Ke curse say: You hasten surrender Han wang!
translations.idiomatic: Ke cursed and said: 'You hasten to surrender to the Han king!'

sentences.zh: 不然，今為虜矣！」

translations.literal: Not so, now become captives!
translations.idiomatic: If not, you will now become captives!'

sentences.zh: 項羽怒，亨周苛。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu was angry and cooked Zhou Ke.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜周昌為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Then he appointed Zhou Chang as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 常從擊破項籍。

translations.literal: He often followed in striking and breaking Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 以六年中與蕭、曹等俱封：封周昌為汾陰侯；

translations.literal: With six year middle and Xiao, Cao etc together enfeoff: enfeoff Zhou Chang as Fen Yin marquis;
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the sixth year he was together enfeoffed with Xiao, Cao, and others: Zhou Chang was enfeoffed as Marquis of Fenyin;

sentences.zh: 周苛子周成以父死事，封為高景侯。

translations.literal: Zhou Ke's son Zhou Cheng, for his father's death in service, was enfeoffed as Marquis of Gaojing.

sentences.zh: 昌為人彊力，敢直言，自蕭、曹等皆卑下之。

translations.literal: Chang as a person was strong and forceful, daring to speak directly. Even Xiao, Cao, and others all treated him with deference.

sentences.zh: 昌嘗燕時入奏事，高帝方擁戚姬，昌還走，高帝逐得，騎周昌項，問曰：「我何如主也？」

translations.literal: Chang once feast time enter memorialize affairs, Gao Di just embrace Qi consort, Chang return run, Gao Di chase obtain, ride Zhou Chang neck, ask say: I what like sovereign?
translations.idiomatic: Once during a feast Chang entered to memorialize affairs. The Gao Emperor was just embracing Consort Qi. Chang returned and ran. The Gao Emperor chased and caught him, rode on Zhou Chang's neck, and asked: 'What kind of sovereign am I?'

sentences.zh: 昌仰曰：「陛下即桀紂之主也。」

translations.literal: Chang look up say: Your majesty namely Jie Zhou of sovereign.
translations.idiomatic: Chang looked up and said: 'Your Majesty is namely a sovereign like Jie and Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 於是上笑之，然尤憚周昌。

translations.literal: Then the sovereign laughed at it, but especially feared Zhou Chang.

sentences.zh: 及帝欲廢太子，而立戚姬子如意為太子，大臣固爭之，莫能得；

translations.literal: Reach emperor wish abolish crown prince, and establish Qi consort son Ru Yi as crown prince, great ministers firmly dispute it, none able obtain;
translations.idiomatic: When the emperor wished to abolish the crown prince and establish Consort Qi's son Ruyi as crown prince, the great ministers firmly disputed it, but none could prevail;

sentences.zh: 上以留侯策即止。

translations.literal: The sovereign stopped because of Marquis Liu's strategy.

sentences.zh: 而周昌廷爭之彊，上問其說，昌為人吃，又盛怒，曰：「臣口不能言，然臣期期知其不可。

translations.literal: But Zhou Chang court dispute it strong, sovereign ask its explanation, Chang as person stutter, again great anger, say: Minister mouth not able speak, however minister qi qi know its not able.
translations.idiomatic: But Zhou Chang disputed it strongly in court. The sovereign asked for his explanation. Chang as a person stuttered, and was greatly angered again, saying: 'This minister's mouth cannot speak, but this minister qi qi knows it is not possible.

sentences.zh: 陛下雖欲廢太子，臣期期不奉詔。」

translations.literal: Your Majesty though wishes to abolish the crown prince, this minister qi qi will not receive the decree.'

sentences.zh: 上欣然而笑。

translations.literal: The sovereign laughed happily.

sentences.zh: 既罷，呂后側耳於東箱聽，見周昌，為跪謝曰：「微君，太子幾廢。」

translations.literal: Already dismiss, Lu empress incline ear at east chamber listen, see Zhou Chang, for kneel thank say: Without you, crown prince almost abolish.
translations.idiomatic: After it was dismissed, Empress Lu inclined her ear to listen from the eastern chamber. Seeing Zhou Chang, she knelt and thanked him saying: 'Without you, the crown prince would almost have been abolished.'

sentences.zh: 是後戚姬子如意為趙王，年十歲，高祖憂即萬歲之後不全也。

translations.literal: After this, Consort Qi's son Ruyi became Zhao king, aged ten. Gaozu worried that after his ten thousand years he would not be whole.

sentences.zh: 趙堯年少，為符璽御史。

translations.literal: Zhao Yao was young in years, serving as tally and seal censor.

sentences.zh: 趙人方與公謂御史大夫周昌曰：「君之史趙堯，年雖少，然奇才也，君必異之，是且代君之位。」

translations.literal: Zhao person Fang Yu gong tell censor grand master Zhou Chang say: Your of secretary Zhao Yao, year though young, however strange talent, you must different treat him, this and replace your position.
translations.idiomatic: A Zhao person Fang Yugong told Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang: 'Your secretary Zhao Yao, though young in years, is nevertheless a strange talent. You must treat him differently. He will replace your position.'

sentences.zh: 周昌笑曰；

translations.literal: Zhou Chang laugh say;
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang laughed and said:

sentences.zh: 「堯年少，刀筆吏耳，何能至是乎！」

translations.literal: Yao year young, knife brush official ear, what able arrive this!
translations.idiomatic: 'Yao is young, just a knife and brush official, how could he reach this!'

sentences.zh: 居頃之，趙堯侍高祖。

translations.literal: After a short time, Zhao Yao attended Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖獨心不樂，悲歌，群臣不知上之所以然。

translations.literal: Gaozu alone was unhappy in heart, sang sadly. The group of ministers did not know the cause of the sovereign's sadness.

sentences.zh: 趙堯進請問曰：「陛下所為不樂，非為趙王年少而戚夫人與呂后有卻邪？

translations.literal: Zhao Yao advance request ask say: Your majesty what for not happy, not for Zhao wang year young and Qi consort with Lu empress have grudge?
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yao advanced and requested to ask: 'Your Majesty is unhappy because of this - is it not because Zhao king is young in years and Consort Qi has a grudge with Empress Lu?'

sentences.zh: 備萬歲之後而趙王不能自全乎？」

translations.literal: Prepare ten thousand years after but Zhao wang not able self preserve?
translations.idiomatic: 'Preparing for after ten thousand years and Zhao king cannot preserve himself?'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「然。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Correct.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Correct.

sentences.zh: 吾私憂之，不知所出。」

translations.literal: I privately worry about it, and do not know what to do.'

sentences.zh: 堯曰：「陛下獨宜為趙王置貴彊相，及呂后、太子、群臣素所敬憚乃可。」

translations.literal: Yao say: Your majesty alone should for Zhao wang establish noble strong chancellor, and Lu empress, crown prince, group ministers always what revere fear then can.
translations.idiomatic: Yao said: 'Your Majesty alone should establish a noble and strong chancellor for Zhao king, one whom Empress Lu, the crown prince, and the group of ministers have always revered and feared, then it will be possible.'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「然。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Correct.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Correct.

sentences.zh: 吾念之欲如是，而群臣誰可者？」

translations.literal: I think it want like this, but group ministers who suitable ones?
translations.idiomatic: I think of it and want it to be like this, but which of the group of ministers would be suitable?'

sentences.zh: 堯曰：「御史大夫周昌，其人堅忍質直，且自呂后、太子及大臣皆素敬憚之。

translations.literal: Yao say: Censor grand master Zhou Chang, his person firm endure simple straight, moreover from Lu empress, crown prince and great ministers all always revere fear him.
translations.idiomatic: Yao said: 'Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang - his person is firm, enduring, simple, and straight, and moreover Empress Lu, the crown prince, and the great ministers have all always revered and feared him.

sentences.zh: 獨昌可。」

translations.literal: Alone Chang is suitable.'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃召周昌，謂曰：「吾欲固煩公，公彊為我相趙王。」

translations.literal: Then then summon Zhou Chang, tell say: I wish indeed trouble you, you strong for me chancellor Zhao wang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he summoned Zhou Chang and said: 'I wish to indeed trouble you. You must strongly serve as my chancellor for Zhao king.'

sentences.zh: 周昌泣曰：「臣初起從陛下，陛下獨柰何中道而棄之於諸侯乎？」

translations.literal: Zhou Chang weep say: Minister initial rise follow your majesty, your majesty alone how middle way and abandon him at feudal lords?
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang wept and said: 'This minister initially rose following Your Majesty. How can Your Majesty alone abandon him midway to the feudal lords?'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「吾極知其左遷，然吾私憂趙王，念非公無可者。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: I extremely know its demotion, however I private worry Zhao wang, think not you no suitable ones.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'I extremely know this is a demotion for him, but I privately worry about Zhao king. I think there is no one suitable except you.

sentences.zh: 公不得已彊行！」

translations.literal: You have no alternative strong go!
translations.idiomatic: You have no alternative but to go strongly!'

sentences.zh: 於是徙御史大夫周昌為趙相。

translations.literal: Then he moved Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang to serve as Zhao chancellor.

sentences.zh: 既行久之，高祖持御史大夫印弄之，曰：「誰可以為御史大夫者？」

translations.literal: Already go long time, Gao Zu hold censor grand master seal play it, say: Who can be censor grand master ones?
translations.idiomatic: After he had gone for a long time, Gaozu held the Censor Grand Master seal and played with it, saying: 'Who can serve as Censor Grand Master?'

sentences.zh: 孰視趙堯，曰：「無以易堯。」

translations.literal: Fixed gaze Zhao Yao, say: No with change Yao.
translations.idiomatic: He fixed his gaze on Zhao Yao and said: 'There is no one to change for Yao.'

sentences.zh: 遂拜趙堯為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Then he appointed Zhao Yao as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 堯亦前有軍功食邑，及以御史大夫從擊陳豨有功，封為江邑侯。

translations.literal: Yao also previously had military merit with a food fief, and as Censor Grand Master followed in striking Chen Xi with merit, was enfeoffed as Marquis of Jiangyi.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，呂太后使使召趙王，其相周昌令王稱疾不行。

translations.literal: Gaozu collapsed. Empress Dowager Lu sent a messenger to summon Zhao king. His chancellor Zhou Chang commanded the king to claim illness and not go.

sentences.zh: 使者三反，周昌固為不遣趙王。

translations.literal: The messenger returned three times. Zhou Chang firmly refused to send Zhao king.

sentences.zh: 於是高后患之，乃使使召周昌。

translations.literal: Then Empress Dowager Gao worried about it and sent a messenger to summon Zhou Chang.

sentences.zh: 周昌至，謁高后，高后怒而罵周昌曰：「爾不知我之怨戚氏乎？

translations.literal: Zhou Chang arrive, announce Gao empress dowager, Gao empress dowager angry and curse Zhou Chang say: You not know I of grudge Qi clan?
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang arrived and announced himself to Empress Dowager Gao. Empress Dowager Gao angrily cursed Zhou Chang saying: 'Don't you know of my grudge against the Qi clan?'

sentences.zh: 而不遣趙王，何？」

translations.literal: But not send Zhao wang, what?
translations.idiomatic: 'And you don't send Zhao king, why?'

sentences.zh: 昌既徵，高后使使召趙王，趙王果來。

translations.literal: After Chang was summoned, Empress Dowager Gao sent a messenger to summon Zhao king. Zhao king indeed came.

sentences.zh: 至長安月餘，飲藥而死。

translations.literal: He arrived at Chang'an after more than a month and died from drinking medicine.

sentences.zh: 周昌因謝病不朝見，三歲而死。

translations.literal: Zhou Chang because of claiming illness did not appear at court audiences. After three years he died.

sentences.zh: 後五歲，高后聞御史大夫江邑侯趙堯高祖時定趙王如意之畫，乃抵堯罪，以廣阿侯任敖為御史大夫。

translations.literal: After five years, Empress Dowager Gao heard that Censor Grand Master Jiangyi marquis Zhao Yao had during Gaozu's time decided on the plan for Zhao king Ruyi. Then she charged Yao with a crime and made Guang A marquis Ren Ao Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 任敖者，故沛獄吏。

translations.literal: Ren Ao was a former Pei prison official.

sentences.zh: 高祖嘗辟吏，吏系呂后，遇之不謹。

translations.literal: Gaozu once avoided an official. The official arrested Empress Lu and treated her disrespectfully.

sentences.zh: 任敖素善高祖，怒，擊傷主呂后吏。

translations.literal: Ren Ao had always been on good terms with Gaozu. He was angry and struck and injured the official in charge of Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 及高祖初起，敖以客從為御史，守豐二歲，高祖立為漢王，東擊項籍，敖遷為上黨守。

translations.literal: When Gaozu initially rose, Ao followed as a guest to serve as censor. He guarded Feng for two years. Gaozu was established as Han king and went east to strike Xiang Ji. Ao was moved to serve as Shangdang governor.

sentences.zh: 陳豨反時，敖堅守，封為廣阿侯，食千八百戶。

translations.literal: During Chen Xi's rebellion, Ao firmly guarded his position and was enfeoffed as Marquis of Guang A, with a food fief of one thousand eight hundred households.

sentences.zh: 高后時為御史大夫。

translations.literal: During Empress Dowager Gao's time he served as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 三歲免，以平陽侯曹窋為御史大夫。

translations.literal: After three years he was dismissed, and Pingyang marquis Cao Jiu was made Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 高后崩，（不）與大臣共誅呂祿等。

translations.literal: Empress Dowager Gao collapsed and together with the great ministers executed Lu Lu and others.

sentences.zh: 免，以淮南相張蒼為御史大夫。

translations.literal: He was dismissed, and Huainan chancellor Zhang Cang was made Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 蒼與絳侯等尊立代王為孝文皇帝。

translations.literal: Cang together with the Jiang marquis and others honored and established the Dai king as Emperor Xiaowen.

sentences.zh: 四年，丞相灌嬰卒，張蒼為丞相。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Chancellor Guan Ying died, and Zhang Cang became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 自漢興至孝文二十餘年，會天下初定，將相公卿皆軍吏。

translations.literal: From Han's rise to over twenty years into Xiaowen's reign, as the world was initially settling, the generals, chancellors, dukes, and ministers were all military officials.

sentences.zh: 張蒼為計相時，緒正律歷。

translations.literal: When Zhang Cang served as accounting chancellor, he continued to correct the laws and calendars.

sentences.zh: 以高祖十月始至霸上，因故秦時本以十月為歲首，弗革。

translations.literal: Because Gaozu in the tenth month began arriving at Bashang, following the old Qin practice which originally used the tenth month as the year's beginning, he did not change it.

sentences.zh: 推五德之運，以為漢當水德之時，尚黑如故。

translations.literal: He calculated the progression of the Five Virtues, thinking that Han was in the time of water virtue, esteeming black as before.

sentences.zh: 吹律調樂，入之音聲，及以比定律令。

translations.literal: He blew the pitchpipes to tune music, incorporated them into the musical sounds, and used comparisons to determine the laws and commands.

sentences.zh: 若百工，天下作程品。

translations.literal: Like the hundred artisans, he made standards and grades for the world.

sentences.zh: 至於為丞相，卒就之，故漢家言律歷者，本之張蒼。

translations.literal: Until he became chancellor, he finally completed it. Therefore, when the Han family spoke of laws and calendars, they based it on Zhang Cang.

sentences.zh: 蒼本好書，無所不觀，無所不通，而尤善律歷。

translations.literal: Cang was originally fond of books, observing nothing without seeing it, passing through nothing without understanding it, but he was especially skilled in laws and calendars.

sentences.zh: 張蒼德王陵。

translations.literal: Zhang Cang was virtuous to Wang Ling.

sentences.zh: 王陵者，安國侯也。

translations.literal: Wang Ling was the Marquis of Anguo.

sentences.zh: 及蒼貴，常父事王陵。

translations.literal: When Cang became noble, he often served Wang Ling as a father.

sentences.zh: 陵死後，蒼為丞相，洗沐，常先朝陵夫人上食，然後敢歸家。

translations.literal: After Ling died, Cang became chancellor. On his days off, he would always first visit Lady Ling in the morning to present food, and only then dare return home.

sentences.zh: 蒼為丞相十餘年，魯人公孫臣上書言漢土德時，其符有黃龍當見。

translations.literal: Cang served as chancellor for over ten years. A man from Lu named Gongsun Chen submitted a memorial saying Han was in the time of earth virtue, and its omen was that a yellow dragon should appear.

sentences.zh: 詔下其議張蒼，張蒼以為非是，罷之。

translations.literal: The decree sent it down for Zhang Cang to discuss. Zhang Cang thought it was not correct and dismissed it.

sentences.zh: 其後黃龍見成紀，於是文帝召公孫臣以為博士，草土德之歷制度，更元年。

translations.literal: Afterwards, a yellow dragon appeared at Chengji. Then Emperor Wen summoned Gongsun Chen to serve as doctor, drafted the calendar system for earth virtue, and changed the first year.

sentences.zh: 張丞相由此自絀，謝病稱老。

translations.literal: From this, Chancellor Zhang diminished himself, claimed illness, and professed old age.

sentences.zh: 蒼任人為中候，大為姦利，上以讓蒼，蒼遂病免。

translations.literal: Cang appointed someone as middle guard who greatly engaged in evil profiteering. The sovereign reprimanded Cang for this, and Cang then claimed illness and was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 蒼為丞相十五歲而免。

translations.literal: Cang served as chancellor for fifteen years and was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 孝景前五年，蒼卒，謚為文侯。

translations.literal: In the fifth year before Xiaojing's reign, Cang died, posthumously titled Marquis Wen.

sentences.zh: 子康侯代，八年卒。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Kang succeeded him and died after eight years.

sentences.zh: 子類代為侯，八年，坐臨諸侯喪後就位不敬，國除。

translations.literal: His son Lei succeeded as marquis. After eight years, convicted of taking his position disrespectfully after attending feudal lords' mourning, the state was abolished.

sentences.zh: 初，張蒼父長不滿五尺，及生蒼，蒼長八尺餘，為侯、丞相。

translations.literal: Initially, Zhang Cang's father was not full five chi in height. When he gave birth to Cang, Cang was over eight chi tall, and became marquis and chancellor.

sentences.zh: 蒼子復長。

translations.literal: Cang's son was tall again.

sentences.zh: 及孫類，長六尺餘，坐法失侯。

translations.literal: When it came to grandson Lei, he was over six chi tall, but lost his marquisate through violation of law.

sentences.zh: 蒼之免相後，老，口中無齒，食乳，女子為乳母。

translations.literal: After Cang was dismissed as chancellor, he grew old. His mouth had no teeth, he drank milk, and women served as wet nurses.

sentences.zh: 妻妾以百數，嘗孕者不復幸。

translations.literal: His wives and concubines numbered in the hundreds, but those who once became pregnant he no longer favored.

sentences.zh: 蒼年百有餘歲而卒。

translations.literal: Cang lived over a hundred years and died.

sentences.zh: 申屠丞相嘉者，梁人，以材官蹶張從高帝擊項籍，遷為隊率。

translations.literal: Chancellor Shen Tu Jia was a man from Liang. As a timber officer with crossbow, he followed Gao emperor in striking Xiang Ji and was promoted to troop commander.

sentences.zh: 從擊黥布軍，為都尉。

translations.literal: He followed in striking Qing Bu's army and became chief commander.

sentences.zh: 孝惠時，為淮陽守。

translations.literal: During Xiaohui's time, he served as Huaiyang governor.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝元年，舉故吏士二千石從高皇帝者，悉以為關內侯，食邑二十四人，而申屠嘉食邑五百戶。

translations.literal: In the first year of Emperor Xiaowen, they selected former officials and gentlemen of two thousand dan who followed Gao emperor. All were made Guan Nei marquises with food fiefs - twenty-four persons, and Shen Tu Jia received a food fief of five hundred households.

sentences.zh: 張蒼已為丞相，嘉遷為御史大夫。

translations.literal: After Zhang Cang had become chancellor, Jia was promoted to Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 張蒼免相，孝文帝欲用皇后弟竇廣國為丞相，曰：「恐天下以吾私廣國。」

translations.literal: Zhang Cang dismiss chancellor, Xiao Wen emperor wish use empress younger brother Dou Guang Guo as chancellor, say: Fear world with I private Guang Guo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Cang was dismissed as chancellor. Emperor Xiaowen wished to use the empress's younger brother Dou Guangguo as chancellor, saying: 'I fear the world will think I favor Guangguo privately.'

sentences.zh: 廣國賢有行，故欲相之，念久之不可，而高帝時大臣又皆多死，餘見無可者，乃以御史大夫嘉為丞相，因故邑封為故安侯。

translations.literal: Guangguo was worthy and had good conduct, so he wished to make him chancellor. After thinking about it for a long time, he decided it was not possible. Moreover, the great ministers from Gao emperor's time had mostly died, and there were no suitable ones remaining. So he made Censor Grand Master Jia chancellor, and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Guan according to his old fief.

sentences.zh: 嘉為人廉直，門不受私謁。

translations.literal: Jia as a person was incorruptible and straightforward. His gate did not accept private visits.

sentences.zh: 是時太中大夫鄧通方隆愛幸，賞賜累巨萬。

translations.literal: At this time, Grand Central Gentleman Deng Tong was greatly favored and fortunate, with rewards accumulating to great tens of thousands.

sentences.zh: 文帝嘗燕飲通家，其寵如是。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen once feasted and drank at Tong's home - his favor was like this.

sentences.zh: 是時丞相入朝，而通居上傍，有怠慢之禮。

translations.literal: At this time, the chancellor entered court, but Tong sat beside the sovereign with disrespectful ritual.

sentences.zh: 丞相奏事畢，因言曰：「陛下愛幸臣，則富貴之；

translations.literal: Chancellor memorialize affairs finish, then speak say: Your majesty love favor minister, then wealthy noble it;
translations.idiomatic: After the chancellor finished memorializing affairs, he then said: 'Your Majesty loves and favors this minister, then make him wealthy and noble;'

sentences.zh: 至於朝廷之禮，不可以不肅！」

translations.literal: Until court of ritual, not can not solemn!
translations.idiomatic: 'But as for court ritual, it cannot but be solemn!'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「君勿言，吾私之。」

translations.literal: Sovereign say: You not speak, I private it.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign said: 'You don't speak. I favor him privately.'

sentences.zh: 罷朝坐府中，嘉為檄召鄧通詣丞相府，不來，且斬通。

translations.literal: After dismissing court, he sat in his mansion. Jia issued a dispatch summoning Deng Tong to the chancellor's mansion. If he did not come, he would behead Tong.

sentences.zh: 通恐，入言文帝。

translations.literal: Tong was afraid and entered to speak to Emperor Wen.

sentences.zh: 文帝曰：「汝第往，吾今使人召若。」

translations.literal: Wen emperor say: You just go, I now make person summon you.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: 'You just go. I will now send someone to summon you.'

sentences.zh: 通至丞相府，免冠，徒跣，頓首謝。

translations.literal: Tong arrived at the chancellor's mansion, removed his hat, went barefoot, and kowtowed in apology.

sentences.zh: 嘉坐自如，故不為禮，責曰：「夫朝廷者，高皇帝之朝廷也。

translations.literal: Jia sit self like, intentionally not do ritual, blame say: Now court ones, Gao emperor of court.
translations.idiomatic: Jia sat as usual, intentionally did not perform ritual, and blamed saying: 'The court is Gao emperor's court.

sentences.zh: 通小臣，戲殿上，大不敬，當斬。

translations.literal: Tong is a small minister who played in the hall - greatly disrespectful, should be beheaded.

sentences.zh: 吏今行斬之！」

translations.literal: Official now carry out behead him!
translations.idiomatic: The official now carry out beheading him!'

sentences.zh: 通頓首，首盡出血，不解。

translations.literal: Tong kowtowed until his head bled completely, but did not stop.

sentences.zh: 文帝度丞相已困通，使使者持節召通，而謝丞相曰：「此吾弄臣，君釋之。」

translations.literal: Wen emperor measure chancellor already embarrass Tong, make messenger hold tally summon Tong, but apologize chancellor say: This I play minister, you release him.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen saw that the chancellor had already embarrassed Tong, so he sent a messenger holding a tally to summon Tong, and apologized to the chancellor saying: 'This is my plaything minister. You release him.'

sentences.zh: 鄧通既至，為文帝泣曰：「丞相幾殺臣。」

translations.literal: Deng Tong already arrive, for Wen emperor weep say: Chancellor almost kill minister.
translations.idiomatic: When Deng Tong arrived, he wept to Emperor Wen saying: 'The chancellor almost killed this minister.'

sentences.zh: 嘉為丞相五歲，孝文帝崩，孝景帝即位。

translations.literal: Jia served as chancellor for five years. Emperor Xiaowen collapsed, and Emperor Xiaojing ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 二年，晁錯為內史，貴幸用事，諸法令多所請變更，議以謫罰侵削諸侯。

translations.literal: In the second year, Chao Cuo served as inner secretary, was noble and fortunate, handled affairs. He requested many changes to various laws and commands, discussing using demotion and punishment to erode and cut back the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 而丞相嘉自絀所言不用，疾錯。

translations.literal: But Chancellor Jia diminished himself, and what he said was not used. He hated Cuo.

sentences.zh: 錯為內史，門東出，不便，更穿一門南出。

translations.literal: Cuo as inner secretary had his gate exit east, which was inconvenient, so he changed it to dig another gate exiting south.

sentences.zh: 南出者，太上皇廟堧垣。

translations.literal: The south exit was beside the Great Supreme Emperor's temple wall.

sentences.zh: 嘉聞之，欲因此以法錯擅穿宗廟垣為門，奏請誅錯。

translations.literal: Jia heard this and wished to use this to accuse Cuo by law of presumptuously digging the ancestral temple wall as a gate, memorializing to request executing Cuo.

sentences.zh: 錯客有語錯，錯恐，夜入宮上謁，自歸景帝。

translations.literal: Cuo's guest spoke to Cuo. Cuo was afraid and entered the palace at night to have audience, surrendering himself to Emperor Jing.

sentences.zh: 至朝，丞相奏請誅內史錯。

translations.literal: When court arrived, the chancellor memorialized requesting to execute Inner Secretary Cuo.

sentences.zh: 景帝曰：「錯所穿非真廟垣，乃外堧垣，故他官居其中，且又我使為之，錯無罪。」

translations.literal: Jing emperor say: Cuo what dig not true temple wall, but outer side wall, therefore other officials dwell among it, moreover again I make for it, Cuo no crime.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Jing said: 'What Cuo dug was not the true temple wall, but the outer side wall. Therefore other officials dwell among it, and moreover I made him do it. Cuo has no crime.'

sentences.zh: 罷朝，嘉謂長史曰：「吾悔不先斬錯，乃先請之，為錯所賣。」

translations.literal: Dismiss court, Jia tell chief clerk say: I regret not first behead Cuo, then first request it, for Cuo what sell.
translations.idiomatic: After dismissing court, Jia told the chief clerk: 'I regret not first beheading Cuo, but first requesting it, and being sold by Cuo.'

sentences.zh: 至舍，因歐血而死。

translations.literal: He arrived at his residence and died from vomiting blood.

sentences.zh: 謚為節侯。

translations.literal: He was posthumously titled Marquis Jie.

sentences.zh: 子共侯蔑代，三年卒。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Gong Mie succeeded him and died after three years.

sentences.zh: 子侯去病代，三十一年卒。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Qubing succeeded him and died after thirty-one years.

sentences.zh: 子侯臾代，六歲，坐為九江太守受故官送有罪，國除。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Yu succeeded him. After six years, convicted of accepting bribes as Jiu Jiang governor from former officials, the state was abolished.

sentences.zh: 自申屠嘉死之後，景帝時開封侯陶青、桃侯劉舍為丞相。

translations.literal: After Shen Tu Jia died, during Emperor Jing's time Kaifeng marquis Tao Qing and Tao marquis Liu She served as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 及今上時，柏至侯許昌、平棘侯薛澤、武彊侯莊青翟、高陵侯趙周等為丞相。

translations.literal: When it reached the present sovereign's time, Baizhi marquis Xu Chang, Pingji marquis Xue Ze, Wuqiang marquis Zhuang Qingdi, Gaoling marquis Zhao Zhou, and others served as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 皆以列侯繼嗣，娖娖廉謹，為丞相備員而已，無所能發明功名有著於當世者。

translations.literal: All succeeded as ranked marquises through inheritance, were cautious and incorruptible, merely filling the chancellor position, with none able to invent merits and fame that manifested in the current world.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：「張蒼文學律歷，為漢名相，而絀賈生、公孫臣等言正朔服色事而不遵，明用秦之顓頊歷，何哉？

translations.literal: Grand Historian say: Zhang Cang literature laws calendars, be Han famous chancellor, but reject Jia Sheng, Gong Sun Chen etc speak correct beginning clothing color matters not follow, clearly use Qin of Zhuan Xu calendar, what?
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: 'Zhang Cang had literary learning in laws and calendars, served as Han's famous chancellor, but rejected Jia Sheng, Gongsun Chen and others' words about correcting the calendar beginning and clothing colors matters and did not follow them, clearly using Qin's Zhuan Xu calendar - why?'

sentences.zh: 周昌，木彊人也。

translations.literal: Zhou Chang was a man from Muqiang.

sentences.zh: 任敖以舊德用。

translations.literal: Ren Ao was used because of old virtue.

sentences.zh: 申屠嘉可謂剛毅守節矣，然無術學，殆與蕭、曹、陳平異矣。

translations.literal: Shen Tu Jia can be called firm and resolute, guarding integrity. However, without method and learning, he was nearly different from Xiao, Cao, and Chen Ping.

sentences.zh: 孝武時丞相多甚，不記，莫錄其行起居狀略，且紀征和以來。

translations.literal: During Emperor Xiaowu's time the chancellors were very many. I do not record them, and none recorded their conduct and daily life conditions briefly. Moreover, I record from Zhenghe onwards.

sentences.zh: 有車丞相，長陵人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor You Che was a man from Changling.

sentences.zh: 卒而有韋丞相代。

translations.literal: He died and Chancellor Wei replaced him.

sentences.zh: 韋丞相賢者，魯人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei was a worthy man, a person from Lu.

sentences.zh: 以讀書術為吏，至大鴻臚。

translations.literal: He became an official through the method of reading books, reaching Great Honglu.

sentences.zh: 有相工相之，當至丞相。

translations.literal: A physiognomy artisan read his face and said he should reach chancellor.

sentences.zh: 有男四人，使相工相之，至第二子，其名玄成。

translations.literal: He had four sons. He made the physiognomy artisan read them. When it came to the second son, his name was Xuancheng.

sentences.zh: 相工曰：「此子貴，當封。」

translations.literal: Physiognomy artisan say: This son noble, should enfeoff.
translations.idiomatic: The physiognomy artisan said: 'This son will be noble and should be enfeoffed.'

sentences.zh: 韋丞相言曰：「我即為丞相，有長子，是安從得之？」

translations.literal: Wei chancellor speak say: I namely be chancellor, have eldest son, this how from obtain it?
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Wei said: 'If I become chancellor and have an eldest son, where would this nobility come from?'

sentences.zh: 後竟為丞相，病死，而長子有罪論，不得嗣，而立玄成。

translations.literal: Later he actually became chancellor and died of illness. The eldest son was convicted of crime and could not succeed, so Xuancheng was established.

sentences.zh: 玄成時佯狂，不肯立，竟立之，有讓國之名。

translations.literal: At the time Xuancheng pretended madness and was unwilling to be established, but he was actually established and had the name of yielding the state.

sentences.zh: 後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，為關內侯，失列侯，得食其故國邑。

translations.literal: Later he was convicted of riding to the temple disrespectfully. By decree his rank was reduced one level, becoming Guan Nei marquis, losing his ranked marquis status, and obtaining the food from his former state's fief.

sentences.zh: 韋丞相卒，有魏丞相代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei died, and Chancellor Wei replaced him.

sentences.zh: 魏丞相相者，濟陰人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei Xiang was a man from Jiyin.

sentences.zh: 以文吏至丞相。

translations.literal: He reached chancellor as a literary official.

sentences.zh: 其人好武，皆令諸吏帶劍，帶劍前奏事。

translations.literal: His person was fond of martial affairs. He commanded all officials to wear swords, wearing swords before memorializing affairs.

sentences.zh: 或有不帶劍者，當入奏事，至乃借劍而敢入奏事。

translations.literal: If there were those who did not wear swords, when they should enter to memorialize affairs, they would arrive and borrow swords before daring to enter and memorialize affairs.

sentences.zh: 其時京兆尹趙君，丞相奏以免罪，使人執魏丞相，欲求脫罪而不聽。

translations.literal: At that time Jing Zhao prefect Zhao Jun was memorialized by the chancellor to be exempted from crime. He sent people to arrest Chancellor Wei, wishing to seek escape from crime, but Wei did not listen.

sentences.zh: 復使人脅恐魏丞相，以夫人賊殺待婢事而私獨奏請驗之，發吏卒至丞相舍，捕奴婢笞擊問之，實不以兵刃殺也。

translations.literal: He again sent people to threaten and frighten Chancellor Wei, using the matter of his wife bandit-killing a waiting maid, privately memorializing alone to request verification. He sent officials and soldiers to the chancellor's residence, captured the slaves and maids, caned and struck them in questioning - in reality they had not killed with weapons.

sentences.zh: 而丞相司直繁君奏京兆尹趙君迫脅丞相，誣以夫人賊殺婢，發吏卒圍捕丞相舍，不道；

translations.literal: But chancellor superintendent justice Fan Jun memorialize Jing Zhao prefect Zhao Jun coerce threaten chancellor, falsely accuse with wife bandit kill maid, send officials soldiers surround capture chancellor residence, not way;
translations.idiomatic: But the chancellor's superintendent of justice Fan Jun memorialized that Jing Zhao prefect Zhao Jun coerced and threatened the chancellor, falsely accusing him of his wife bandit-killing the maid, sending officials and soldiers to surround and capture the chancellor's residence - not the proper way;

sentences.zh: 又得擅屏騎士事，趙京兆坐要斬。

translations.literal: Moreover, he obtained matters of presumptuously dismissing cavalry gentlemen. Zhao Jing Zhao was convicted and warranted beheading.

sentences.zh: 又有使掾陳平等劾中尚書，疑以獨擅劫事而坐之，大不敬，長史以下皆坐死，或下蠶室。

translations.literal: Moreover, he had assistants Chen Ping and others impeach the central secretary, suspecting him of alone presumptuously conducting robbery matters and convicting him - greatly disrespectful. The chief clerk and below were all convicted to die, or sent to the silkworm room.

sentences.zh: 而魏丞相竟以丞相病死。

translations.literal: But Chancellor Wei ultimately died as chancellor from illness.

sentences.zh: 子嗣。

translations.literal: His son succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，為關內侯，失列侯，得食其故國邑。

translations.literal: Later he was convicted of riding to the temple disrespectfully. By decree his rank was reduced one level, becoming Guan Nei marquis, losing his ranked marquis status, and obtaining the food from his former state's fief.

sentences.zh: 魏丞相卒，以御史大夫邴吉代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei died, and Censor Grand Master Bing Ji replaced him.

sentences.zh: 邴丞相吉者，魯國人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Bing Ji was a man from Lu state.

sentences.zh: 以讀書好法令至御史大夫。

translations.literal: Through reading books and being fond of laws and commands, he reached Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 孝宣帝時，以有舊故，封為列侯，而因為丞相。

translations.literal: During Emperor Xiaoxuan's time, because of old acquaintance, he was enfeoffed as a ranked marquis, and therefore became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 明於事，有大智，後世稱之。

translations.literal: Clear about affairs, he had great wisdom. Later generations praised him.

sentences.zh: 以丞相病死。

translations.literal: He died as chancellor from illness.

sentences.zh: 子顯嗣。

translations.literal: His son Xian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，失列侯，得食故國邑。

translations.literal: Later he was convicted of riding to the temple disrespectfully. By decree his rank was reduced one level, losing his ranked marquis status, and obtaining the food from his former state's fief.

sentences.zh: 顯為吏至太仆，坐官秏亂，身及子男有姦贓，免為庶人。

translations.literal: Xian served as an official and reached Tai Pu. Convicted of official waste and disorder, his person and sons and males having corrupt bribes, he was exempted and became a commoner.

sentences.zh: 邴丞相卒，黃丞相代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Bing died, and Chancellor Huang replaced him.

sentences.zh: 長安中有善相工田文者，與韋丞相、魏丞相、邴丞相微賤時會於客家，田文言曰：「今此三君者，皆丞相也。」

translations.literal: Chang An middle have good physiognomy artisan Tian Wen person, with Wei chancellor, Wei chancellor, Bing chancellor lowly humble time meet at guest home, Tian Wen speak say: Now this three gentlemen, all chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In Chang'an there was a good physiognomy artisan named Tian Wen who, when Chancellor Wei, Chancellor Wei, and Chancellor Bing were lowly and humble, met them at a guest's home. Tian Wen said: 'Now these three gentlemen, they are all chancellors.'

sentences.zh: 其後三人竟更相代為丞相，何見之明也。

translations.literal: Later these three persons actually alternated in replacing each other as chancellor - what clear vision!

sentences.zh: 黃丞相霸者，淮陽人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Huang Ba was a man from Huaiyang.

sentences.zh: 以讀書為吏，至潁川太守。

translations.literal: Through reading books he became an official, reaching Yingchuan governor.

sentences.zh: 治潁川，以禮義條教喻告化之。

translations.literal: He governed Yingchuan, using rites and righteousness to teach, enlighten, inform, and transform the people.

sentences.zh: 犯法者，風曉令自殺。

translations.literal: Those who violated the law, he instructed and advised them to commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 化大行，名聲聞。

translations.literal: The transformation was greatly implemented, his fame and reputation were heard.

sentences.zh: 孝宣帝下制曰：「潁川太守霸，以宣布詔令治民，道不拾遺，男女異路，獄中無重囚。

translations.literal: Xiao Xuan emperor issue decree say: Ying Chuan governor Ba, with announce proclaim imperial orders govern people, roads not pick up lost things, men women different paths, prisons middle no heavy prisoners.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaoxuan issued a decree saying: 'Yingchuan governor Ba, through announcing and proclaiming imperial orders to govern the people, the roads have no lost things picked up, men and women take different paths, prisons have no serious prisoners.'

sentences.zh: 賜爵關內侯，黃金百斤。」

translations.literal: Grant the rank of Guan Nei marquis, one hundred catties of yellow gold.'

sentences.zh: 徵為京兆尹而至丞相，復以禮義為治。

translations.literal: He was summoned to be Jing Zhao prefect and reached chancellor, again governing with rites and righteousness.

sentences.zh: 以丞相病死。

translations.literal: He died as chancellor from illness.

sentences.zh: 子嗣，後為列侯。

translations.literal: His son succeeded him, later becoming a ranked marquis.

sentences.zh: 黃丞相卒，以御史大夫于定國代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Huang died, and Censor Grand Master Yu Dingguo replaced him.

sentences.zh: 于丞相已有廷尉傳，在張廷尉語中。

translations.literal: Chancellor Yu already has a biography as court judge, in the Zhang Court Judge chapter.

sentences.zh: 于丞相去，御史大夫韋玄成代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Yu left, Censor Grand Master Wei Xuancheng replaced him.

sentences.zh: 韋丞相玄成者，即前韋丞相子也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei Xuancheng was the son of the former Chancellor Wei.

sentences.zh: 代父，後失列侯。

translations.literal: He replaced his father, later losing his ranked marquis status.

sentences.zh: 其人少時好讀書，明於詩、論語。

translations.literal: As a youth he was fond of reading books, clear about the Poetry and Analects.

sentences.zh: 為吏至衛尉，徙為太子太傅。

translations.literal: He served as an official reaching Wei Wei, then was moved to be Crown Prince Grand Tutor.

sentences.zh: 御史大夫薛君免，為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Censor Grand Master Xue Jun was exempted, and he became Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 于丞相乞骸骨免，而為丞相，因封故邑為扶陽侯。

translations.literal: Chancellor Yu begged to be exempted on account of old age, and he became chancellor, therefore enfeoffing his former fief as Fu Yang marquis.

sentences.zh: 數年，病死。

translations.literal: After several years, he died of illness.

sentences.zh: 孝元帝親臨喪，賜賞甚厚。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaoyuan personally attended the mourning, granting very generous rewards.

sentences.zh: 子嗣後。

translations.literal: His son succeeded him later.

sentences.zh: 其治容容隨世俗浮沈，而見謂諂巧。

translations.literal: His governance was yielding and followed worldly customs in rising and sinking, but was seen as flattering and skillful.

sentences.zh: 而相工本謂之當為侯代父，而後失之；

translations.literal: But physiognomy artisan originally say him should be marquis replace father, but after lose it;
translations.idiomatic: But the physiognomy artisan originally said he should become a marquis to replace his father, but later lost it;

sentences.zh: 復自游宦而起，至丞相。

translations.literal: Again rising from wandering as an official, he reached chancellor.

sentences.zh: 父子俱為丞相，世閒美之，豈不命哉！

translations.literal: Father son both be chancellor, world between praise it, how not fate!
translations.idiomatic: Father and son both became chancellor, the world praised it - how is this not fate!

sentences.zh: 相工其先知之。

translations.literal: The physiognomy artisan knew it beforehand.

sentences.zh: 韋丞相卒，御史大夫匡衡代。

translations.literal: Chancellor Wei died, Censor Grand Master Kuang Heng replaced him.

sentences.zh: 丞相匡衡者，東海人也。

translations.literal: Chancellor Kuang Heng was a man from Donghai.

sentences.zh: 好讀書，從博士受詩。

translations.literal: He was fond of reading books, following scholars to receive the Poetry.

sentences.zh: 家貧，衡傭作以給食飲。

translations.literal: His family was poor, Heng hired himself out for work to provide food and drink.

sentences.zh: 才下，數射策不中，至九，乃中丙科。

translations.literal: His talent descended, he shot at the policy questions several times without hitting, until the ninth time, then he hit the Bing grade.

sentences.zh: 其經以不中科故明習。

translations.literal: His classics became clear and practiced because of not hitting the grade.

sentences.zh: 補平原文學卒史。

translations.literal: He supplemented as Pingyuan literature graduated secretary.

sentences.zh: 數年，郡不尊敬。

translations.literal: After several years, the commandery did not respect and honor him.

sentences.zh: 御史徵之，以補百石屬薦為郎，而補博士，拜為太子少傅，而事孝元帝。

translations.literal: The censor summoned him, using a supplement of hundred stone subordinate to recommend him as a gentleman, and supplementing as a scholar, appointing him crown prince lesser tutor, serving Emperor Xiaoyuan.

sentences.zh: 孝元好詩，而遷為光祿勳，居殿中為師，授教左右，而縣官坐其旁聽，甚善之，日以尊貴。

translations.literal: Xiaoyuan was fond of Poetry, so he was moved to be Guanglu Xun, dwelling in the palace as teacher, teaching and instructing those on left and right, while county officials sat by his side listening, very much praising it, daily becoming more honored and noble.

sentences.zh: 御史大夫鄭弘坐事免，而匡君為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Censor Grand Master Zheng Hong was exempted for matters, and Gentleman Kuang became Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，韋丞相死，匡君代為丞相，封樂安侯。

translations.literal: After a year remaining, Chancellor Wei died, Gentleman Kuang replaced him as chancellor, enfeoffed as Le'an marquis.

sentences.zh: 以十年之閒，不出長安城門而至丞相，豈非遇時而命也哉！

translations.literal: With ten years interval, not exit Chang An city gate and arrive chancellor, how not encounter time and fate!
translations.idiomatic: In the space of ten years, without leaving Chang'an's city gates he reached chancellor - how is this not encountering the times and fate!

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：深惟士之游宦所以至封侯者，微甚。

translations.literal: Grand Historian say: Deep think gentlemen of wander official so arrive enfeoff marquis ones, subtle very.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: 'Deeply considering the reasons gentlemen wandering as officials arrive at being enfeoffed as marquises - it is very subtle.'

sentences.zh: 然多至御史大夫即去者。

translations.literal: However, many who reach Censor Grand Master then leave.

sentences.zh: 諸為大夫而丞相次也，其心冀幸丞相物故也。

translations.literal: Those who are grand masters next in line for chancellor, their hearts hope for the chancellor to die.

sentences.zh: 或乃陰私相毀害，欲代之。

translations.literal: Or then secretly and privately slander and harm each other, wishing to replace him.

sentences.zh: 然守之日久不得，或為之日少而得之，至於封侯，真命也夫！

translations.literal: However guard it days long not obtain, or be it days few and obtain it, arrive at enfeoff marquis, true fate also!
translations.idiomatic: However, guarding it for long days without obtaining it, or being it for few days and obtaining it, arriving at being enfeoffed as marquis - it is truly fate!

sentences.zh: 御史大夫鄭君守之數年不得，匡君居之未滿歲，而韋丞相死，即代之矣，豈可以智巧得哉！

translations.literal: Censor grand master Zheng gentleman guard it several years not obtain, Kuang gentleman dwell it not full year, but Wei chancellor die, namely replace him, how can with wisdom skill obtain!
translations.idiomatic: Censor Grand Master Zheng gentleman guarded it for several years without obtaining it, Gentleman Kuang dwelt in it less than a full year, but Chancellor Wei died and he immediately replaced him - how can this be obtained with wisdom and skill!

sentences.zh: 多有賢聖之才，困妯囡者眾甚也。

translations.literal: Many have the talents of worthies and sages, but those distressed and impoverished are very numerous.
